clinical_study.brief_title: Community Enabled Readiness for First 1000 Days Learning Ecosystem
clinical_study.official_title: Community Enabled Readiness for First 1000 Days Learning Ecosystem

brief_summary.textblock: The CRADLE (Community-enabled Readiness-for-1000-Days Learning Ecosystem) initiative seeks to improve first-time families' self-efficacy in parenting and to tangibly impact factors in maternal and child care which will result in improved health of mother and child.

detailed_description.textblock:
Title: CRADLE (Community enabled Readiness for first 1000-Days Learning Ecosystem) Project
Introduction:
The "developmental origins of health and disease" (DOHaD) is a concept that has emerged over the past 50 years, linking the state of health and risk from disease in early childhood and adult life. With increasing evidence in neuroscience of the critical window of the first 1000 days of life which has life- long impact on cognitive, behavioral, physical and mental health of an individual. In present society where new parents learned the skills from social media which are based on personal perception and not evidence.
CRADLE (Community-enabled Readiness-for-1000-Days Learning Ecosystem) initiative seeks to improve first-time families' self-efficacy in parenting and to tangibly impact factors in maternal and child care which will result in improved health of mother and child.
Hypothesis:
Use of an integrated choice architecture in a self-learning eco-community, with calibrated nudges, and group interactions & home visits in the first 1000-days for first-time families will improve parenting self-efficacy.
Method:
This will be an Interventional Cohort Study. Each ARM 250 subjects. ARM 1 : Routine care ARM 2 : Behavioral Intervention with nudges and Facebook interaction ARM 3 : Community Intervention with face-to-face & home visits
The follow up period will be from first contact till child reaches 2 years old Measurement.
The investigators will quantify the impact of this initiative through measurements of specific health & nutrition domains & patient-reported outcome measures (see below) as well as participant satisfaction.
The two key health morbidities the investigators are addressing are the overall health and mental wellness of first-time families as well as their metabolic health (ie, nutrition).
1. Mother's Height and Weight (BMI)
2. Child's Height and Weight (BMI)
3. PROMIS Global-10 Scale
4. Patient Health Questionaire-2
5. Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale
6. Parental Sense Of Competency Scale
7. Tool To Measure Parenting Self-Efficacy (TOPSE)
8. Birth Satisfaction Scale
9. Breastfeeding Self-Efficacy Scale
10. Infant Feeding Questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months of age, from 6 weeks after birth until 24 months of age
primary_outcome.description: Parenting self-efficacy as assessed by the Tool to measure Parenting Self-Efficacy, which is domain-specific.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months of age, from 6 weeks after birth until 24 months of age
primary_outcome.description: Parenting self-efficacy as assessed by the Parental Sense of Competence Scale, which is domain-general.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 18 months of age, from first trimester in pregnancy until 18 months during the postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Health Experience as assessed by the Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Global10.
Birth Experience as assessed by the Birth Satisfaction Scale - Revised.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months of age, from first trimester in pregnancy up to 6 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Mental wellness as assessed by the Patient Health Questionnaire-2.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 months of age, from first trimester in pregnancy up to 6 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Depressive symptoms as assessed by the Edinburg Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, from first trimester in pregnancy up to 24 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal nutritional status as assessed based on weight status, i.e. weight gain and weight retention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth until up to 24 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Child nutritional status as assessed based on weight and height.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth until up to 6 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Breastfeeding self-efficacy as assessed by the Breastfeeding Self-Efficacy Score-Short Form.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 18 months of age, at 18 months during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.description: Maternal feeding beliefs and practices as assessed by the Infant Feeding Questionnaire.

clinical_study.condition: Nutritional Health of Mother and Child

arm_group.description: Participants will undergo routine care but take part in assessments.
Participants will receive nudges and be enrolled in social media platform.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Arm 3: Community Intervention with home visits
arm_group.description: Participants will receive midwife visits and phone calls

intervention.intervention_name: Arm 2:Behavioral Intervention with nudges & Facebook interaction
intervention.description: Participants will receive nudges and be enrolled to Facebook group for self-learning.

intervention.intervention_name: Arm 3: Community Intervention with home visits
intervention.description: Participants will receive home visits and phone calls by skilled midwives.
intervention.arm_group_label: Arm 3: Community Intervention with home visits

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. First-time mothers
2. Be at least 17 years of age
3. Is residing in Singapore for the next 3 years
4. Understand English, or has a family member who is able to assist.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has existing medical conditions such as chronic illnesses

link.description: TOPSE Tool to measure Parenting Self-Efficacy

patient_data.ipd_description: Access to IPD will be limited to the project study team only.
